problem.p: A uniform bar of mass \(m\) and length \(L\) is pivoted at one end and is held vertically as shown. After the bar is released, it swings downward with no friction in the pivot.
At the instant the bar is at the bottom of the swing, find the magnitudes of the following quantities:
The angular speed of the bar \(\omega=\)
The linear speed of the free end of the bar \(v_e=\)
The horizontal component of the acceleration of the free end of the bar \(a_{xe}=\)
The linear speed of the midpoint of the bar \(v_m=\)
The angular acceleration of the bar \(\alpha=\)
The vertical component of the acceleration of the free end of the bar \(a_{ye}=\)
The horizontal component of the acceleration of the midpoint of the bar \(a_{xm}=\)
The vertical component of the acceleration of the midpoint of the bar \(a_{ym}=\)
The horizontal component of the force exerted on the bar by the hinge \(F_x=\)
The vertical component of the force exerted on the bar by the hinge \(F_y=\)
